III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
1

of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Approximately 2-3 weeks ago, a youth was inappropriately
restrained by a staff member. While in the restraint, the staff
member was hitting the youth in the face repeatedly.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 09/09/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth A stated
she was in a foul mood following a “bad visit” with her mother and
probation officer. Youth A stated she asked to speak with her
therapist, but Staff 1 did not notify her therapist. Youth A stated
she stuffed her room door lock with tissue paper and maintenance
came to the unit to repair her room door lock. Youth A stated she
later became upset and threw a chair at Staff 1, which prompted
Staff 1 to call her a bitch and run towards her. Youth A stated she
dropped herself down and sat down on the ground. Youth A stated
Staff 1 tried to place Youth A in a primary restraint hold while
facing her, but Youth A resisted and kicked and pushed Staff 1.
Youth A stated Staff 1 pushed her face with an open hand one
time. Youth A stated she got up and walked to her room when
Crisis Response Team staff 1 came to the unit. Youth A stated
Youth B and Youth C witnessed this interaction with Staff 1. Youth
A stated Staff 1 bruised her left, upper thigh directly above her
knee cap. Youth A was observed with approximately a two-inch
thin, vertical line above her left knee cap. The skin was not broken
and the area was not swollen.
Youth B was interviewed on 09/16/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated
Youth A was upset because she could not go into her room to
sleep. Youth B stated Youth A walked around the unit and stuffed
the door locks until maintenance came to the unit to fix the locks.
Youth B stated Youth A remained upset and threw papers and a
rolling office chair at Staff 1. Youth B stated Staff 1 picked up the
chair handle and gave it to Youth B to hold. Youth B stated Staff 1
then grabbed the office chair wheel from Youth A’s hand. Youth B
2

stated Staff 1 tried to physically manage Youth A when Youth A
tried to pull Staff 1’s wig and threatened to have Staff 1 fired.
Youth B stated Staff 1 tried to redirect Youth A and told Youth A
that her level would be dropped if she continued her behaviors.
Youth C was interviewed on 09/16/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth C stated
Youth A was angry about not being allowed to go into her room.
Youth C stated Youth A “going crazy” and threw papers and threw
a rolling office chair at Staff 1. Youth C stated Youth A hit Staff 1’s
arms while Staff 1 tried to calm Youth A down. Youth C stated she
told Youth A to calm down and Youth A ended up walking towards
her room before assistance arrived on the unit.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 09/17/2025 by phone after an
unsuccessful phone call attempt on 09/16/2025. Staff 1 stated she
worked morning shift on Unit 2A and was mandated to work
afternoon shift on Unit 2A on 08/27/2025. Staff 1 stated Youth A
did not comply with program expectations during both shifts. Staff
1 stated Youth A called her a bitch and threatened to have her
fired. Staff 1 stated Youth A had a pen and threatened to stab
Staff 1 in the neck. Staff 1 stated she continued to redirect Youth
A as Youth A stuffed tissue into the unit’s main door and room
door locks. Staff 1 stated Youth A took the logbook, tore it apart,
and threw the pages on the ground. Staff 1 stated she called for
supervisor assistance and secured the logbook pen in the staff
bathroom. Staff 1 stated Youth A picked up a rolling office chair,
threw it at Staff 1’s leg, and picked up the chair’s wheel that broke
off. Staff 1 stated she redirected Youth A and took the chair’s
rolling wheel out of Youth A’s hand. Staff 1 stated she did not hit
Youth A in this incident. Staff 1 stated Youth A did not request to
speak with her therapist. Staff 1 stated Youth A was not evaluated
by the nurse following this incident because Youth A was not
physically managed or complain of injury.
Crisis Response Team (CRT) 1 was interviewed on 09/11/2025
at Wayne County Juvenile Detention. CRT 1 stated he went to
Unit 2A when there was a support call and found Youth A sitting in
a corner upset. CRT 1 stated Youth A “rambled” about being
treated unfairly (does not recall the specifics). CRT 1 stated Youth
A did not report being hit, restrained, or injured. CRT 1 stated he
redirected Youth A to the other side of the unit in order for
maintenance to work on her room door and other locks she
stuffed. CRT 1 stated he spoke with Youth A for approximately 20
minutes before she complied and went to the other side of the
unit. CRT 1 does not recall the date or time of this interaction.
3

Video
08/27/2025 Unit 2A video was reviewed from multiple angles.
Video does not record sound.
Around 12:21 PM Youth A pokes and plays with the fire
extinguisher lock. Youth A walks around the unit and pokes, stuff,
and plays with door locks.
Around 1:33 PM maintenance staff are on the unit fixing a room
door lock. Staff 1 is seen talking and redirecting Youth A.
Around 3:05 PM Youth A rips apart the unit logbook and has a
verbal exchange with Staff 1.
Around 3:08 PM Youth A picks up a rolling office chair twice and
tosses it each time. Youth A picks up the rolling office chair a third
time and throws it towards Staff 1’s feet. One of the chair’s
armrests and two rolling wheels breaks off the chair. Staff 1 uses
her radio. Youth A picks up the chair’s arm rest and a rolling wheel
and walks away. Youth A drops the armrest as Staff 1
approaches. Staff 1 talks with Youth A and extends her right hand
out for the rolling wheel. Staff 1 faces Youth A and takes the office
chair’s wheel from Youth A’s hand as Youth A yells and grabs at
Staff 1’s arms and shirt. Youth A and Staff 1 walk away from each
other. Youth A tips over a chair.
Around 3:09 PM assistance arrives on the unit. Video does not
show Staff 1 hitting or covering Youth A’s face.
Documentation
Logbook documentation is not available due to Youth A ripping it
apart.
There is no incident report of Youth A throwing a rolling office
chair at Staff 1 and Staff 1 securing the chair’s wheel from Youth
A.
Youth A was not seen by health services following this incident.
Staff 1 was terminated on 09/03/2025 for reasons unrelated to this
investigation.
Unit Layout
Upon entering Unit 2A one steps into the common area with tables
and chairs. Youth bedrooms surround this common area. The staff
desk area is to the right upon entering the unit. The staff desk
area is open and adjoined with the common area.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because Staff 1 did not
physically manage Youth A or hit Youth A in this incident based on
4

witness interviews and video review. Staff 1 immediately secured
the office rolling chair’s wheel from Youth A, which could be used
as a weapon.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
